content:
So it does not send. Is there an error? I am guessing there is but on a whole lot of words you failed to mention what it was.

If the SMTP server named XXXXX is associated with the Identity being used to send mail, Thunderbird will attempt to authenticate using that identity and the relevant token. Is Microsoft "Modern Authentication" incorporating oAuth2.0 broken? It might well be.

What I see far more of is folk with a single Outgoing server (SMTP) being used across multiple identities complaining that it only works on one of them.

I personally see no merit in removing an account and adding it again. If that fixes something your account settings were wrong and the issue could have been resolved much more quickly be correcting the settings. Without the risk of not being about to add it again. Common. Not being able to get the new account to work because the issue was not in the settings. Also very common.

Why delete the passwords? Oauth does not use passwords except when the initial authorization flow occurs and that is Microsoft asking you for your password, via a web page they serve from their web server, to authenticate the request for Thunderbird to access you mail. Thunderbird never actually sees you password in that process, let alone save it. Oauth uses tokens issued by, in this case by Microsoft, following the initial flow and updated by them periodically until they decide they need a new authentication flow to extend the authority of Thunderbird to connect. Depending on how you access their mail server that can be anything from almost daily (where VPN's are used) to like once a year. Last time I was asked was when Transferred my profile to a new computer a couple of years ago.

So did you delete the authentication tokens or you password? Whi9le both can be found in the password manager, they are not the same thing.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
The message seems to be saying that the sent message can't be saved to the email account that's held on the email provider's server.

I use TB as a POP client so I would go to Account Settings )Three lines at the top right /Account Settings) then, under the relevant email account, click on 'Copies and Folders'. Here you can specify where a copy of sent messages is kept - specifically the 'Offline' folders at the bottom of the list of folders in the main interface.

It's 'offline' so won't be mirrored on the email provider's server (unless, of course, when you send the email, your provider copies it into that sent folder).

This may need a better solution. Please respond if this doesn't meet your question.
creator: arlev

content: Have you set up an email profile for your address with the correct settings? Go to the 'Account Settings' (it's under the three lines at the top right), then click on 'Account Actions at the bottom right for a drop down where you can add a mail account.

content: Translation - When setting up my existing email address "dem.ing@web.de" on this computer, I always get the message "Settings were found in the ISP database" after filling in the form. After clicking Done, I get the message "Login to the server failed; configuration, user name ... may be incorrect" after every attempt, even though everything is correct.
creator: arlev

content:
As I understand the TB functions, the first statement (Settings were found...) relates to setting up of the server names, ports and so on. the second statement (Login to the server...) relates more to the password, email address and so on.

Have you accessed your email provider's settings and entered/checked them manually? They're here, I think - https://hilfe.web.de/pop-imap/pop3/index.html
creator: arlev

Translation - When creating a new account, it is necessary to give a password. I forgot it, what should I do?
